title: Energy conservation - proton in 100 N-per-C field

content.description: Two conducting plates hold equal and opposite charges that create a uniform electric field of magnitude <math alttext="E equals 100 newtons per coulomb" overflow="scroll"><mi>E</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>100</mn><mtext> N</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>C</mtext></math> directed to the right, as shown. Points <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> are <math alttext="0.0050 meter" overflow="scroll"> <mn>0.0050</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mtext>m</mtext> </math> apart. A proton is released from rest at Point <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>.
content.question: What is the kinetic energy of the proton when it reaches Point <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"> <mtext>B</mtext> </math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="8.0 times 10 to the negative 20 power joule" overflow="scroll"><mn>8.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>20</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></mrow></msup><mtext>J</mtext></math>

<math alttext="1.6 times 10 to the negative 17 power joule" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>17</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></math>

<math alttext="3.2 times 10 to the negative 15 power joule" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>15</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="8.0 times 10 to the negative 20 power joule" overflow="scroll"><mn>8.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>20</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></mrow></msup><mtext>J</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
